FILE: cm350640v11.0.txt
DYAD: GREECE-TURKEY/OTTOMAN EMPIRE
RIVALRY: RIV927
DISPUTE(S): MID1579 
RIVALRY: RIV928
DISPUTE(S): MID2367 
RIVALRY: RIV929
DISPUTE(S): MID1576 MID1575 MID1574 MID1573 MID2835 MID141 MID1571 MID2836 MID1739 MID1569 MID1249 MID1250 MID257 MID3344 MID324 MID1270 MID3183 
RIVALRY: RIV930
DISPUTE(S): MID1278 MID1279 MID1280 MID1292 MID1293 MID2173 MID1290 MID1289 MID2174 MID2176 MID2177 MID2179 MID3909 MID4040 MID4092 MID4095 MID4323 MID4193 MID4133 MID4210 MID4233 MID4320 

PS: 19009999-19250430 0.00 19250501-19340208 -9 19340209-19571231 0.5 19580101-20209999 0.00

PS-UPDATE2020:

PS1800: 18661000-18999999 0.0

PSNOTES: thompson rivalry cm350640 ,19550000 ,20100000 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220303
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220303

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID1579 MID2367 MID1576 MID1575 MID1574 MID1573 MID2835 MID141 MID1571 MID2836 MID1739 MID1569 

WWI MIDs: MID257 MID3344 MID324 

MID1249 

TERRMID: MID1249 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1249 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1249 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1249 Greece and the Ottomans disputed all of Crete, which includes Crete's territorial waters. 

ISLMID: MID1249 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID1249 from Gibler 2018, in 1909, the islanders of Crete raised the Greek flag, and to deter Greece from annexing the island, Turkey mobilized troops and dispatched some forces near the island, triggering this MID. Coded islands MID because this was connected to sovereignty over the island of Crete. 

CIVWARMID: MID1249 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1249 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1249 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1249 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1249 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1250 

TERRMID: MID1250 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1250 from Gibler 2018, Yugoslavia (Serbia), Greece, and Bulgaria were former parts of the Ottoman empire, but were pressing claims against the Ottomans in the lead-up to WWI. Here, all three countries were seeking to take pieces of Ottoman territory in the Balkan peninsula, and they declared war on the Ottomans. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to disputed territory in the Balkans. 

TERRLINK: MID1250 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1250 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1250 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1250 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1250 although in the late 20th century, the Balkan Wars of Independence against Serbia/Yugoslavia involved many rebel groups fighting along ethnic lines, there is no indication in Gibler 2018, cm narrative, or a search on LexisNexis and NYT Archives that there were rebel groups operating at the time of this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1250 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1250 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1250 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1250 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:

MID1270 

TERRMID: MID1270 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1270 from Gibler 2018, after the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, the Greeks pressed longstanding territorial claims against Turkey and invaded several pieces of territory with large Greek populations, starting a war between Greece and Turkey. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to territorial disputes between Turkey and Greece. 

TERRLINK: MID1270 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1270 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1270 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1270 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1270 although in the late 20th century, the Balkan Wars of Independence against Serbia/Yugoslavia involved many rebel groups fighting along ethnic lines, there is no indication in Gibler 2018, cm narrative, or a search on LexisNexis and NYT Archives that there were rebel groups operating at the time of this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1270 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1270 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1270 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3183 

TERRMID: MID3183 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3183 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3183 from cm narrative, this MID occurred after the Treaty of Lausanne in 1925. Greece protested Turkey's dismissal of a powerful religious authority figure who also had much influence in Greece, triggering this MID. Coded not territory because this was connected to a disagreement over a religious authority figure, not over territory. 

TERRLINK: MID3183 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3183 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID3183 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1278 

TERRMID: MID1278 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1278 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1278 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, Cypriots were rioting and clashing with British troops on the island. However, no threats were issued by any country involved. Coded not territory because this was not an attempt by any country to advance its territorial claim, and coded uncertain because GML argue this should not be considered a MID. 

TERRLINK: MID1278 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1278 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1278 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1278 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1278 from GML 2016, this involved rioting citizens in Cyprus (domestic protests), but there is no indication of militarized rebel activity. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1278 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1278 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1278 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1278 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1279 

TERRMID: MID1279 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1279 this MID occurred in Cyprus, but was connected to the outbreak of civil conflict, not (yet) to a territorial claim on Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID1279 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1279 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1279 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1279 1 -- civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1279 from Gibler 2018, in 1963, tensions between Greek and Turkish Cypriots came to a boil in 1963. At that time, Cyprus (and its capital) was divided. Cyrpus operated under a system of government that guaranteed a Greek president and a Turkish vice persident, but this system was contributing to the tensions. Civil violence broke out, and Greek Cypriots came close to seizing the Turkish portion of the capital. Turkey threatened to deploy troops. Greece responded with a threat of troop deployment. UN peacekeepers eventually came to Cyprus. Coded civil war MID because this involved militarized civil conflict activity in which the Turkish part of the capital was nearly overrun. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1279 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1279 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1279 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1279 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1280 

TERRMID: MID1280 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1280 from Gibler 2018, in 1967, tensions over Cyprus escalated. Turkey amassed troops across the water from Cyprus and flew recon flights over the island. The UN successfully defused tensions before fighting broke out. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed territory of Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID1280 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1280 this MID is also linked to the territorial dispute between Cyrpus and Turkey, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1280 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1280 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1280 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID1280 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1280 from Gibler 2018, this MID was precipitated by Greek and Turkish armed civilian "patrols" clashing in Cyprus (outside this dyad), which led to the Turkish government amassing troops near Cyrpus. Coded civil war link because these patrols are considered militarized rebel groups. Both Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot patrols existed and were armed, and each were organized to oppose the other government that was claiming Cyprus. 

COUPMID: MID1280 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1280 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1280 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1292 

TERRMID: MID1292 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1292 while the territorial dispute over Cyprus was still active, per cm narrative, Turkey and Greece had a separate rivalry centered specifically on conflicting claims in the Aegean Sea, and this MID involves that dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID1292 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1292 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1292 from Gibler 2018, Turkey granted mineral exploration rights to a company, granting it permission to explore in the waters in the disputed East Aegean Sea. Greece had already granted exclusive rights to other countries in those waters. Turkey flew planes over Cyprus as a show of force, and both countries put their militaries on high alert. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to the disputed waters in the Aegean Sea. 

ISLMID: MID1292 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1292 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1292 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1292 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1292 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1292 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1293 

TERRMID: MID1293 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1293 from Gibler 2018, this is the Turkish-Cypriot War in 1974. A coup in Greece led to a Turkish invasion of Cyprus and fighting between Turkey and Greece over Cyprus. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the dispute over Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID1293 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1293 this MID is also linked to the territorial dispute between Cyrpus and Turkey, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1293 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1293 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1293 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1293 there is no indication in Gibler 2018, cm narrative, or news coverage of this MID that militarized rebels were involved. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1293 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1293 1 -- coup MID
COUPMID-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: MID1293 this MID involved a coup in Greece in 1974. The man who led the coup demanded Greece forces vacate their military bases, but they did not. Turkey suspected that a conflict over Cyprus may erupt and invaded Cyprus. 

COUPLINK: MID1293 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1293 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2173 

TERRMID: MID2173 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2173 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2173 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2173 from Gibler 2018, in 1974, Turkey announced that all aircraft that reached the Aegean median line must radio Turkey and report their flight plans, but Greece refused as the Aegean median line was far within their own territory. Turkey announced that the flight path was unsafe and Greece foritified its East Aegean islands. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to the active maritime dispute in the Aegean Sea, per cm narrative. 

ISLMID: MID2173 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2173 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2173 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2173 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2173 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1290 

TERRMID: MID1290 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1290 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1290 from Gibler 2018, Greece and Turkey were in negotiations over Cyprus when Greece threatened aggression in the Aegean Sea if provoked by Turkey. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to Cyprus and was probably connected to showing strength during negotiations. 

TERRLINK: MID1290 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1290 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1290 this was also connected to the territorial dispute between Turkey and Cyrpus, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1290 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1290 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1290 coded maritime MID because although this MID was directly connected to Cyprus, it also involved a threat of force in the Aegean Sea, a disputed maritime boundary. 

ISLMID: MID1290 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1290 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

MID1289 

TERRMID: MID1289 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1289 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1289 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1289 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1289 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1289 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1289 from Gibler 2018, in 1976 Greece ordered naval mobilization in response to Turkish exercises in the Aegean. Greece protested and later conducted its own naval exercises. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to their disputed waters in the Aegean Sea. 

ISLMID: MID1289 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1289 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

MID2174 

TERRMID: MID2174 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2174 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2174 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2174 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2174 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2174 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2174 from Gibler 2018, Turkey shot at and destroyed a Greek fishing boat that they claim was in Turkish waters. Coded maritime MID because per cm narrative, this MID occurred in the disputed Aegean waters. 

ISLMID: MID2174 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2174 1 -- certain

MID2176 

TERRMID: MID2176 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2176 from Gibler 2018, this was connected partially to conflicting airspace claims between Greece and Turkey. However, most violations that Greece protested were NATO exercises. Coded not territory because this was connected to NATO exercises and not Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID2176 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2176 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2176 from Gibler 2018, this MID also involved Greece protesting Turkey shelling Greek naval and fishing vessels, but this did not occur in disputed waters and the US explained that the shelling was likely just shrapnel from the naval exercises. 

ISLMID: MID2176 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2176 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain

COUPLINK: MID2176 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2176 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2177 

TERRMID: MID2177 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2177 from Gibler 2018, Greece and Turkey exchanged threats over claims over Cyprus and waters in the Aegean. 

TERRLINK: MID2177 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2177 this MID is also connected to the territorial dispute between Turkey and Cyprus, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID2177 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2177 from Gibler 2018, Greece and Turkey exchanged threats over claims over Cyprus and waters in the Aegean. 

ISLMID: MID2177 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2177 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain

COUPMID-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2177 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2177 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2179 

TERRMID: MID2179 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2179 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2179 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2179 from Gibler 2018, Greece protested a Turkish research vessel present in their territorial waters, but Turkey claimed the vessel was in international waters. Greece later complained that Turkish naval vessels fired shots near a Greek vessel in international waters. Later, a Greek vessel was intent on drilling in international waters and Turkey warned against doing so. Coded maritime MID because per cm narrative, this MID invovles waters that were disputed between Greece and Turkey. 

ISLMID: MID2179 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2179 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2179 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2179 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2179 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2179 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3909 

TERRMID: MID3909 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3909 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3909 from Gibler 2018, Turkish aircraft violated Greek airspace during military exercises. Coded not territory because there is no indication that this was connected to the dispute over Cyprus. It was not uncommon for both countries to conduct exercises in the area. 

TERRLINK: MID3909 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3909 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID-CER: MID3909 1 -- certain

MID4040

TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4040 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4040 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4040 from Gibler 2018, Greece signed a UN convention to expand its territorial waters which granted Greece much more territorial water in the Aegean, and Turkey protested and conducted military exercises. Greece eventually conceded and did not expand its waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to Greece's maritime boundary. 

ISLMID: MID4040 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4040 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4040 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4040 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4040 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4040 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4092 

TERRMID: MID4092 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4092 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4092 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4092 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4092 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4092 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4092 from Gibler 2018, this is a series of minor clashes over Greece and Turkey's claims in the Aegean Sea. The countries also committed airspace violations against each other. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to claims in the Aegean Sea. 

ISLMID: MID4092 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4092 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK: MID4092 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4092 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4095 

TERRMID: MID4095 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4095 from Gibler 2018, Turkish troops killed a Greek Cypriot soldier in the buffer zone in Cyprus. Numerous threats, border violations, and shows of force followed. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the territorial dispute over Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID4095 1 -- third party link to territorial MID 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4095 this MID is also connected to the Turkey-Cyrpus territorial dispute, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID4095 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4095 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4095 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4095 there is no indication in Gibler 2018, cm narrative, or news coverage that this MID involves militarized rebels. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4095 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4095 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4323 

TERRMID: MID4323 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4323 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4323 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4323 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4323 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4323 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4323 from Gibler 2018, in 1977 Turkish planes violated Greek airspace, prompting protest. From cm narrative, this airspace was over the Aegean Sea, an area of disputed waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to disputed waters in the Aegean. 

ISLMID: MID4323 3 -- not islands

MID4193 

TERRMID: MID4193 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4193 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4193 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4193 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4193 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4193 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4193 from Gibler 2018, in 1997 Turkish fighters engaged with Greek jets that were guarding the Greek defense minister on an overseas trip. Numerous airspace violations by both countries occurred. From cm narrative, these events occurred in the Aegean over disputed waters there. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime dispute in the Aegean Sea.

MID4133 

TERRMID: MID4133 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4133 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4133 from Gibler 2018, Greek and Turkish tensions escalated over Cyprus in 1999. Here, a series of airspace violations occurred. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the Cyprus dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID4133 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4133 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4133 this MID also involves the territorial dispute between Turkey and Cyprus, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID4133 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4133 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4133 although this MID occurred as a flare-up over Cyprus, per cm narrative and Gibler 2018, it also involves an airspace violation over disputed waters in the Aegean Sea.

MID4233 

TERRMID: MID4233 3 -- not territory

TERRLINK-CER: MID4233 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4233 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4233 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4233 from Gibler, miller, and Little 2016, this is an extension of MID4210 and is a part of the repeated airspace violations by each country. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to disputed waters in the Aegean, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this MID be dropped and merged with MID4210. 

ISLMID: MID4233 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4233 1 -- certain

MID4320 

TERRMID: MID4320 2 -- somewhat connected to territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4320 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4320 from Gibler 2018, Greece wanted a 12-mile airspace boundary from its shore but Turkey only accepted 6 miles. Numerous airspace violations occurred during this disagreement. Coded somewhat connected to territory because this was connected to a disagreement over airspace, an extension of the territory of Greece. 

TERRLINK: MID4320 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4320 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4410 

TERRMID: MID4410 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4410 from cm narrative, Turkish fighter jets harassed Greek jets returning from joint military operations in Cyprus. The day prior, Turkish jets were accused of violating Cypriot airspace. The incidents are a manifestation of a long-standing dispute between Greece and Turkey over the status of Cyprus. First day of dispute was on 4/3/2002 and last day of dispute was on 4/3/2002. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID4410 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4410 this MID also involves the territorial dispute between Turkey and Cyrpus, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID4410 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4410 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4410 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4410 there is no indication in cm narrative, Gibler 2018, or news coverage of this MID that indicates any militarized rebel involvement. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4410 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4410 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4410 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4410 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4415 

TERRMID: MID4415 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4415 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4415 from cm narrative, On 11/08/2002, two Turkish fighter jets harass Greek civilian aircrafts in the air corridor connecting Cyprus to Greece. The Greek government protested the incident, which came preceding a peace plan on Cyprus that had been submitted to the UN. Given the location and timing of this dispute relative to the issuance of the peace plan, this action was coded as being part of the dispute over Cyprus and not the dispute over competing maritime claims in the Aegean. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to Cyprus. 

TERRLINK: MID4415 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4415 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4415 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4415 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4423 

TERRMID: MID4423 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4423 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4423 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4423 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4423 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4423 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4423 from cm narrative, this MID is comprised of a dispute between Greece and Turkey over their maritime boundaries in the Aegean Sea. Once again, the incidents of this MID are shows of force, with each state flying its aircraft into the disputed territory and 'harassing' the aircraft of the other state. First day of dispute was on 10/21/2004 and last day of dispute was on 3/30/2005.

ISLMID: MID4423 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4423 1 -- certain

MID4435 

TERRMID: MID4435 3 -- not territory

TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4435 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4435 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4435 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4435 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4435 from Gibler 2018, this MID is multiple shows of force in the Aegean over maritime navigation rights in the disputed areas of the Aegean. Coded maritime MID because this is connected to a maritime dispute in the Aegean Sea. 

ISLMID: MID4435 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4435 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:
